raw_text:
Jugnot 'tops French actor league'
 
 Actor Gerard Jugnot - star of the Oscar-nominated film The Chorus - has beaten Gerard Depardieu to become France's best-paid actor of 2004.
 
 Jugnot made 5.45m Euros (£3.77m) last year, according to a table drawn up by France's Le Figaro newspaper. In The Chorus (Les Choristes), Jugnot plays an inspiring music teacher at a school for troubled boys in 1949. Despite starring in five films in 2004, Depardieu made 3.35m Euros (£2.31m) putting him third place in the chart. "His name [Depardieu] is no longer sufficient to guarantee the success of a film," said Le Figaro newspaper. The Chorus, which Jugnot also co-produced, has drawn an audience of nearly nine million people since its release last year.
 
 Godzilla star Jean Reno was France's second best-paid actor in 2004, earning 3.55m Euros (£2.45m) . His roles include a recent uncredited cameo in the Oscar-nominated Hotel Rwanda. The highest-ranking woman on Le Figaro's list was Audrey Tautou in 10th place, earning 885,000 Euros (£611,000). She starred in Jean-Pierre Jeunet's A Very Long Engagement (Un Long Dimanche de Fiancailles) and is also lined up to co-star with Tom Hanks in Ron Howard's The Da Vinci Code. The Chorus is nominated for best foreign film at Sunday's Oscar ceremony. On Saturday, it will compete for the title of best film against fellow nominee A Very Long Engagement in France's Cesar film awards.
llama3.2:1b:
Gerard Jugnot earns 5.45m Euros (£3.77m) as the best-paid actor in France for 2004.
Gerard Depardieu makes 3.35m Euros (£2.31m), putting him third place.
Jean Reno is second with 3.55m Euros (£2.45m).
Audrey Tautou earns the highest ranking, 10th place and 885k Euros (£611k).
llama3.2:3b: Gerard Jugnot became France's top-paid actor in 2004 earning 5.45m Euros, beating Gerard Depardieu who earned 3.35m Euros, while Jean Reno was second with 3.55m Euros and Audrey Tautou ranked 10th. The Chorus, starring Jugnot, is nominated for Oscar and Cesar awards.
gemma2:2b: Gerard Jugnot earned 5.45 million Euros as France's highest-paid actor in 2004. This follows his success in the film "The Chorus" which was nominated for an Oscar and is competing for best foreign film at the ceremony.  Jean Reno came second and Audrey Tautou placed tenth on the list.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Gerard Jugnot became France's best-paid actor of 2004 after earning €3.78 million (£3.19 million) as a star in The Chorus, an Oscar-nominated film about a music teacher at a troubled school. He surpassed his former rival Gerard Depardieu by 545,000 euros (£376,000), making him third on France's best-paid actors list of that year. Jugnot also co-produced the film "The Chorus," which has drawn an audience of nearly nine million people since its release in 2004.

On the other hand, Jean-René Jouanno had the highest ranking on Le Figaro's list with €3.56 million (£2.78 million) for starring as an uncredited cameo in Hotel Rwanda directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet. His role included a recent uncredited appearance in A Very Long Engagement (Un Long Dimanche de Fiancailles). Audrey Tautou, who was 10th on Le Figaro's list with €885,000 (£629,000), starred in Jean-Pierre Jeunet's A Very Long Engagement and is also co-starring in Tom Hanks' The Da Vinci Code. Jugnot's film "The Chorus" was nominated for best foreign film at the Sunday Oscars and will compete against fellow nominee Hotel Rwanda in France's Cesar film awards on Saturday.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Actor Gerard Jugnot topped French actor league with 5.45m Euros (£3.77m) in 2004. He starred in The Chorus, a music school film from 1949. Depardieu came second at 3.35m Euros (£2.31m), while Jean Reno was third with 3.55m Euros (£2.45m) for his role in Hotel Rwanda. Audrey Tautou placed 10th, earning £611,000. The Chorus and A Very Long Engagement are competing for best foreign film awards at Oscar nominations.
qwen2.5:3b: Actor Gerard Jugnot topped France's best-paid actor list in 2004, earning 5.45m Euros from The Chorus (Les Choristes), where he plays an inspiring music teacher at a school for troubled boys. Depardieu came second with 3.35m Euros despite co-starring in the film. Godzilla star Jean Reno was third, earning 3.55m Euros. Audrey Tautou ranked tenth on the list, earning 885,000 Euros. The Chorus, directed by Luc Besson and also starring Gerard Jugnot as producer, won best foreign film nomination at the Oscars, competing against A Very Long Engagement for the Cesar award.

tinyllama:1.1b:
Jugnot 'tops French actor league'
Actress Gerard Jugnot has beaten actress Gerard Depardieu to become France's highest-paid actor of 2004, earning 5.45m Euro ($3.77m) for his role as an inspirational music teacher in The Choruses (Les Choristes). Depardiue earned 3.35m Euro ($2.31m) for his work in five films released last year, but Jugnot also starred in several recent releases, including the Oscar-nominated film A Very Long Engagement (Un Long Dimanche de Fiancailles), co-starring with Jean Reno. Meanwhile, Godzilla actress Jean Reno was France's second highest-paid actor in 2004, earning 3.55m Euro ($2.45m). The top-ranking woman on Le Figaro's list is Audrey Tauto, who earned 885,000 Euro ($611k) for her role in A Very Long Engagement and co-starring with Tom Hanks in Ron Howard's The Da Vinci Code.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
The most famous actor in France, Gerard Depardieu, came out on top in the annual Le Figaro pay-to-win rankings. According to the publication, the French actor's earnings from films like The Chorus (Les Choristes) and A Very Long Engagement amounted to $3.77 million. 

Gerard Depardieu, who plays an inspiring music teacher in Les Choristes, out-paid his competitor, Gerard Jugnot, by a significant margin. Despite starring in five films released in 2004, Depardieu made $5.45 million (£3.77 million). The ranking reflects the actor's popularity and financial success in France's movie industry.

Jean Reno, who portrays Godzilla in the blockbuster film Godzilla, was ranked second in Le Figaro's list of best-paid French actors. His role included a cameo appearance in Hotel Rwanda, which also starred Audrey Tautou and earned her 885,000 Euros ($611,000) on top of her already impressive salary from A Very Long Engagement.

Audrey Tautou, who is set to co-star with Tom Hanks in Ron Howard's The Da Vinci Code, also ranked high in Le Figaro's rankings. She will play a prominent character alongside the Oscar-nominated actor and earned $885,000 (£611,000) for her role in The Chorus. The film is nominated for best foreign film at this Sunday's Academy Awards ceremony.
